DOC.brief_summary: This phase II clinical trial study well omega-3 fatty acid work treat patient stage I-III breast cancer . Studying sample tissue blood laboratory breast cancer patient receive omega-3 fatty acid may help doctor learn effect omega-3 fatty acid tumor cell .
DOC.brief_title: Omega-3 Fatty Acid Treating Patients With Stage I-III Breast Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine omega-3 dietary supplementation ( omega-3 fatty acid ) result higher polyunsaturated fatty acid ( PUFA ) level surgical specimen normal malignant breast tissue woman take omega 3 tablet comparison take placebo . II . To determine omega-3 dietary supplementation result higher PUFA level plasma red blood cell woman take omega 3 tablet comparison take placebo . III . To determine omega-3 dietary supplementation affect metabolites omega-3 omega-6 PUFA surgical specimen malignant normal breast tissue comparison control . IV . To determine woman take omega-3 dietary supplementation less proliferation great apoptosis malignant breast tissue comparison woman take placebo . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . ARM I : Patients receive omega-3 fatty acid orally ( PO ) daily 7-14 day . ARM II : Patients receive placebo PO daily 7-14 day .
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnose stage I III breast cancer carcinoma situ ( include lobular carcinoma situ [ LCIS ] ductal carcinoma situ [ DCIS ] ) Breast surgery ( lumpectomy mastectomy ) plan least 7 day day enrollment Ability understand willingness sign Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approve write informed consent document Tumor measure least 1 centimeter image physical exam Any patient surgery schedule < 7days biopsy Patients unable refrain use NSAID fulldose acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA ) contain NSAID take study drug Patients receive neoadjuvant chemotherapy eligible Patients currently take omega3 fatty acid , unable randomize placebo Patients previously take omega3 fatty acid within 1 month prior study enrollment Patients allergy know hypersensitivity fish
